intro: Hieracium spilotum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from June to September, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium spilotum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
